page.title: 19BEAUPRE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {BEAUPRE COMMUNITY PRIMARY SCHOOL Beaupre Community Primary School is a co-educational day school which is controlled by Cambridgeshire County Council but which is situated on the Norfolk side of the village. It was built in 1939 and replaced the two Victorian built schools in the village. In September 1985 there were 125 children on roll at the school and a teaching staff of 5.5. The Headteacher at the school was Mr. Charles Weston. Beaupre is a Community Primary School and has close links with groups in the village. Up to 20 clubs,groups and organisations use the school premises on a regular basis. These include the local Women's Institute, Badminton Club,Social Club and Youth Club. The Playgroup has its own room on the school premises and there is a
